intro: Crotalaria paniculata var. nagarjunakondensis, commonly known as the Nagarjuna Konda crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant is notable for its striking yellow flowers and compound leaves, which are typical of the genus Crotalaria. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in open grasslands and disturbed soils. This variant is of particular interest due to its unique geographical distribution and potential ecological significance.
